intro: Veronica diosmifolia, commonly known as the silverleaf speedwell, is a perennial flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its silver-gray foliage and small blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It is often used in rock gardens due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value. The flowers bloom in spring and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
